results.title: Screen magazine. No. 10
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This is the United Nations”.
Cinemagazine items: 1. Guatemala tells a new story - The United Nations is at work in this Central American country, bringing a new way of life to the inhabitants, who struggle to exist in a barren and unfertile land. 2. Palestine refugees - As a result of political upheaval in the Near East, nearly a million Arab refugees have fled to the deserts of Palestine. The United Nations has set up a Relief and Works Agency to assist these refugees.

results.title: Screen magazine. No. 07
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This is the United Nations”.
Cinemagazine items: 1. The International Court of Justice - This Court, the highest of all tribunals, is the principal judicial organ of the United Nations. It holds its sessions in the Peace Palace at the Hague, Holland and consists of fifteen independent judges, elected regardless of nationality. 2. The Republic of Indonesia - When the Japanese were driven out of the Dutch colony of Indonesia at the end of World War II the national leaders declared the country a republic. However negotiations with the Dutch resulted in violence. When peace was finally established by United Nations action, it was agreed that Indonesia become a sovereign state linked to the Netherlands in a union based on free will with equal rights.

results.title: Screen magazine. No. 06
results.creator_credit: Leo Herwood and United Nations. Film Board
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This is the United Nations”.
Cinemagazine items: 1. London centre checks influenza - By swift recognition of the type and strain of virus causing influenza, the World Health Organisation centre at London helps to check epidemics. 2. UN laboratory aids fight on opium smuggling - In New York the UN narcotic Division has set up a laboratory which identifies the source of any opium seized, thus assisting authorities to trace smugglers.

results.title: Screen magazine. No. 05
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This is the United Nations”.
Cinemagazine items: 1. Indian students perform for UN club - Members of the United Nations Secretariat regularly learn about the cultures of many nations. The songs and dances of India are presented and explained. 2. UN votes independence for Libya by 1952 - After centuries of living under conquerors, Libya was liberated by the Allies in 1943. United Nations voted in 1949 that Libya should become an independent and sovereign state by 1952. A UN Commission is helping Libya to work out her transition from colonial status to independence.

results.title: The First essential skills
results.creator_credit: Joachim Schult, Richard Creagh-Osborne and United Nautical Publishers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Sailing”.
One of a course of three films of instruction in sailing a small light dinghy (420 class). Intended for schools, sailing schools and clubs. Animation by Peter Milne.

results.title: This is me : foundation for young Australians (July 2009) : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Six young Indigenous Australians look back and reflect on the things, events and people that have inspired, encouraged and, ultimately, shaped them into the youth leaders they have become. While telling different stories, they all have some common themes, of family, connection to their land and culture and spirituality. The stories brim with optimism and uplift and inspire in much the same way that these young people were inspired by the stories of their ancestors.

results.title: Britain's new resources
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
A brief study of the uses to which Britain is putting her limited natural resources; the harvesting, scientific drying, and storing of short grass for feeding cattle all the year round; the planting of forests and cutting of timber; harnessing of hydro-electric power; soap manufacture without fats; the use of seaweed in the manufacture of many products; production of magnesium from the waters of the North Sea.

group_siblings.title: An Hour from London
group_siblings.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Crown Film Unit

results.title: Sense of taste
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
Countless guidebooks to the epicurean delights of the Continent have obscured to many, the traditional delicacies of the British table and cellar. This film shows some of the delicacies which have made Britain famous; the haggis, kippers and whisky of Scotland, the York ham, Oxford marmalade and the Stilton cheeses of the towns and cities of provincial England. In London, at the “Cheshire Cheese” tavern in Fleet Street, visitors may partake of the celebrated “Pudding” - made with rump steak, kidneys and oysters and weighing some 60 pounds.

results.title: Old crafts new graces
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
Shows that, although the machine dominates the industrial scene of today, traditional British craftsmanship still plays an essential part in the production of certain goods. Examples illustrating such craftsmanship include: the making of a fishing rod; the work of the silversmith; skill with leather in the manufacture of saddles.
